entry.title: New study raises question: Can coronavirus spread through sex?

media:group.media:title: New study raises question: Can coronavirus spread through sex?
media:group.media:description: New research in China shows that coronavirus can remain in the semen of men who have been formerly diagnosed with the illness. #CNN #News

entry.title: Two children die in NY after experiencing ‘very rare’ syndrome that may be linked to coronavirus

media:group.media:title: Two children die in NY after experiencing ‘very rare’ syndrome that may be linked to coronavirus
media:group.media:description: Two children in New York have died after experiencing a “very rare” syndrome that may be linked to coronavirus. There are now 73 pediatric patients across New York state who display symptoms similar to Kawasaki disease and toxic shock-like syndrome. CNN’s Athena Jones has more. #CNN #News

entry.title: States paid millions for coronavirus supplies that never arrived

media:group.media:title: States paid millions for coronavirus supplies that never arrived
media:group.media:description: States are banding together to increase their buying power and help prevent fraud, after paying millions of dollars for supplies that never arrived. CNN's Drew Griffin reports. #CNN #News

entry.title: Tara Reade: Biden should not be running on character

media:group.media:title: Tara Reade: Biden should not be running on character
media:group.media:description: Tara Reade, a former Senate aide who has accused Joe Biden of sexually assaulting her in 1993, said in an interview with Megyn Kelly that the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee should withdraw from the 2020 race. MJ Lee reports. #CNN #News

entry.title: Ahmaud Arbery's father: His death was a modern-day lynching

media:group.media:title: Ahmaud Arbery's father: His death was a modern-day lynching
media:group.media:description:
Marcus Arbery Sr. recalls the memory of his son on the day of his 26th birthday. Arbery Sr. called his son's death a "modern-day lynching" following the arrest of two men charged with Ahmaud Arbery's murder.
#CNN #News

media:group.media:title: New jobs report shows record 20.5 million American jobs lost in April
media:group.media:description:

entry.title: Fewer salmon are surviving migration Here's why that matters

media:group.media:title: Fewer salmon are surviving migration Here's why that matters
media:group.media:description:
Fewer and fewer salmon are able to navigate the waters leading inland from the Pacific Ocean due to dams and higher water temperatures. CNN's Bill Weir reports.
#ClimateCrisis #CNN #News

entry.title: New York's secret weapon against climate change. Oysters

media:group.media:title: New York's secret weapon against climate change. Oysters
media:group.media:description:
Hundreds of years ago, oyster reefs helped protect New York City from hurricanes and storm surge. Now, as the city prepares for climate change, a project is underway to bring back the long-lost oysters.
#ClimateCrisis #CNN #News

media:group.media:description:

entry.title: Justice Department drops criminal case against Michael Flynn

media:group.media:title: Justice Department drops criminal case against Michael Flynn
media:group.media:description:
The Justice Department is dropping the criminal case against President Donald Trump's first national security adviser, Michael Flynn, whose lies about his contacts with Russia prompted Trump to fire him three years ago and special counsel Robert Mueller to flip him to cooperate in the Russia investigation. The request to drop the case, filed with a federal judge in DC District Court, is a sudden end to a protracted legal battle that's lately been fertile ground for Trump to attack the early Russia investigation and former FBI leadership he dislikes. The court must still formally approve the request.
#Flynn #CNN #News

entry.title: Trump administration rejects CDC guidance on reopening US

media:group.media:title: Trump administration rejects CDC guidance on reopening US
media:group.media:description:
The Trump administration will not implement the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's 17-page draft recommendation for reopening America, a senior CDC official confirmed to CNN. The guidance provided more detailed suggestions beyond the reopening guidelines the administration had put forth last month, including specific suggestions for schools and churches. President Donald Trump in recent days has emphasized the need to quickly reopen the American economy despite public health officials' urgings for a more cautious approach. A senior CDC official confirmed to CNN Wednesday night that it was clear that the White House was not going to implement their 17-page draft recommendation for reopening America -- after it asked for it. The White House's decision to not use the guidance was first reported by The Associated Press.
#Coronavirus #CNN #News
